form.name: BC Manufacturing Jobs Fund: Stream 2A - Full Application Form

components.label: HTML
components.content:
BC Manufacturing Jobs Fund: Full Application Form – Stream 2A

Based on your initial proposal, you are invited to submit a full application for the project outlined. This process will collect detailed information about your business, your planned project, market assessment, project impacts, and the financial profile of both your business and the planned project. In addition to providing the information requested in this form, you must submit supporting documentation as listed on the following page.

Completing the Online Form

  • You can save drafts and return to the form at any time to review and edit your responses before submitting your application. Click on "VIEW ALL SUBMISSIONS" to review your list of in progress submissions and select "Edit" to continue inputting information.
  • Be sure to save your draft application frequently (every 10- 15 minutes) by clicking the save icon on the top right-hand corner of the window.
  • After you have submitted, you can view your completed application at any time by logging into the form and selecting "VIEW ALL SUBMISSIONS". You can also select "EMAIL A RECEIPT OF THIS SUBMISSION" to receive an email with a link to your completed application.

Application Process and Next Steps

  • This proposal is step two of a two-step application process.
  • After submitting your application and all required supporting materials, you will hear from us throughout the assessment and financial due diligence process. We will keep you updated on the status of your application; decisions are typically made within 10-12 weeks after submitting a full application.

Applications submitted under the program are subject to the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act. The information being collected is for the purpose of administering the program and will be used for the purpose of evaluating eligibility under the program. Information collected through the application process may be disclosed to Government of British Columbia staff outside of the Manufacturing Jobs Fund in order to conduct due diligence on this application. In addition, the applicant organization’s name, location, funded activity, and award amount may be made publicly available, including worldwide by way of the Internet, should funding be awarded.

components.label: I consent to information provided about my project being shared with provincial and federal government departments and agencies in the interest of exploring matching funding opportunities.
Next
The following documentation is required to evaluate your full application. Please select all documentation types that you have provided:

values.label: Completed Project Budget template, outlining your project’s capital expenses and sources of funding
Quotes, quantity survey estimates or other material (i.e. documentation from vendors) to help validate the budget

components.label: If you are unable to provide the documentation outlined above, please explain why.

Is there anything we should know to help inform our understanding or explain any variances in your recent financial statements? Additionally, have there been any recent financial events in the time since your financial statements were prepared that we should know of? Include any of the contingent liabilities, off balance sheet liabilities, and subsequent events not included in the submitted financial statements which would have a material impact on the information provided.

Is there anything that would materially affect your ability to deliver the project and/or accept funding from the BC Manufacturing Jobs Fund (e.g. known upcoming business closures/sales or curtailments; being in arrears with taxes; etc.)?
If yes – Please describe (you are also advised to contact MJF staff to discuss further):
Please submit as relevant; you may be required to provide this documentation when your application is being reviewed.

values.label: Market assessment or proof of market demand
Letters of confirmation from your suppliers demonstrating sustained access to materials
Feasibility studies, technical assessments, pilot/demonstration reports or any other project-specific information that support the viability of the planned project
Design plans, architectural and engineering reports, environmental assessments
Letters of support or endorsement from the community and/or local First Nations
If readily available, projected 3 to 5 years’ forecasted financials in Excel format showing all formulas, including projected annual balance sheet, income statement and cash flow statement

components.label: Previous
Next

components.html: Please note that information entered in this section may be shared publicly if funding is awarded.
components.label: Text/Images
Organization Legal Name (the lead applicant overseeing the project):

components.html:
Brief Project Description 

Summarize the proposed project including:

  • Major capital activities, deliverables and expenses to be undertaken
  • Equipment, technology or processes to be purchased and implemented
components.label: Text/Images

components.html: Please confirm the main contact for your project:
components.label: Text/Images

Is the person with signing authority at your organization the same as the project contact?
This is the person that will sign the Contribution Agreement on your organization’s behalf if your project is approved for funding.
Who are the owners of the organization?
Does your organization have a board or other governing body?
If yes, please list your board member names and their roles. Add more lines as needed or append a list to your application.
Does your organization have a parent company?
Does your organization have any subsidiary, affiliated or related companies?
If yes, provide the following information for each:
Has your organization previously received federal or provincial loans, grants or other forms of government funding?

components.html: How many employees does your organization currently employ?
components.label: Text/Images
How many employees does your organization currently employ in BC?

components.html: To the best of your knowledge, approximately what percentage of your current workforce and management identity as:
components.label: Text/Images
Workforce
components.content: Indigenous Peoples: First Nations (status or non-status), Métis, or Inuit

components.label: How many employees does your organization currently employ in BC?

Describe the type and quality of employment that your organization offers, including any details about how your organization creates and sustains long-lasting, well-paying job opportunities for local workers.
Previous
Next
Provide a detailed description of the project’s overall objectives and desired outcomes.
What is/are the product(s) that will be manufactured as a result of the capital project?
Indicate which process listed below best aligns with your organization’s operations (choose all that apply):

values.label: Primary processing of raw materials (i.e. initial treatment of raw material to prepare them for shipment for further processing, such as manufacturing lumber from raw logs)

Secondary processing (processes used to further modify the output of primary processing to improve the material’s properties, appearance, and dimensions, such as using lumber to create wooden pallets, cabinets and countertops, veneer, etc.)

Advanced manufacturing (the use of innovative technology such as robotics, 3D printing, automation or other advanced technologies to create value-added products such as mass timber, or bioproducts, etc.)

components.label: Who are the key management staff that will deliver/complete the project? Provide their names, their roles on the project, and a short description of any relevant experience and qualifications.
If your organization has experience implementing similar capital projects, describe the purpose of the project, when it was completed and the total project budget.
List any project partners that have a stake or role in the project (financial or similar) including their specific roles and contributions to the project.

Will new Intellectual Property (IP) be created as a result of this project? Intellectual Property is used to define a concept in which intellectual/creative pursuits – such as inventions, designs, concepts, software, trade secrets, etc. – are treated as property.
If yes – will your organization own the IP?

If applicable, briefly describe the IP strategy the organization will use to manage it and what the ownership structure looks like. If you don’t own it, explain who the owner is and how your organization has rights to use it.

components.html:
Complete this schedule for all major project stages and milestones. We will use this information to track the progress of the project if a Contribution Agreement is signed. 

Please confirm your project’s targeted start and end date:
components.label: Text/Images
Is the proposed project part of a larger capital project?
If yes, outline the scope of the larger project and how it relates to and/or differs from this phase of the project.
What activities have already been completed to prepare for the capital project (e.g., engineering/design plans, environmental assessments, funding confirmations, permits, etc.)?
What remaining activities need to be completed before you can begin the capital project (e.g., engineering/design plans, environmental assessments, funding confirmations, permits)?

Please describe any engagement, endorsement or other forms of support you may have in place for this project (i.e., local community, First Nation(s), other companies). Please attach any supporting documentation (e.g., letters of support, letters of understanding, Council resolutions, etc.) in the Supporting Documentation section.

Identify the key operational or financial risks/barriers to your projects’ success (i.e. litigation, duties and tariffs, challenges with accessing sufficient workforce or supplies, operational or equipment-related challenges, financing plan risks, etc.) and any mitigation strategies that are in place.
Previous
Next
Where will the products that are manufactured as a result of this project be distributed? Select all that apply.

Have you conducted an analysis of the market to confirm a stable and ongoing demand for your products? If yes, please attach any documentation outlining the market assessment in the Supporting Documentation section.
Provide a brief industry overview that includes current condition and future outlook for the sector your organization is in.
Who is the target market for the product(s) being created as a result of the capital project?
Provide a rationale that there is market demand for the specific product(s) your organization is creating. Describe existing vendor/customer relationships if relevant.
List the specific input materials/supplies your organization requires for the product(s) created in the capital project. Include where the materials/supplies are sourced from.
What are your sources of forest input materials?
If applicable, what is your forest tenure volume?
What are your approximate annual fibre/wood requirements for your operations (in board feet, cubic metres, or other units as applicable)?
How concerned are you about your organization’s ability to access a consistent fibre supply to meet your production needs?
Previous
Next
IMPACT AND ALIGNMENT WITH PROGRAM GOALS
Will this project proceed if it does not receive funding under the Manufacturing Jobs Fund? (Select all that apply)

values.label: The project will not be undertaken
The project will be undertaken, but not in B.C.
The project will be undertaken, but at a slower pace
The project will be undertaken, but with a reduced scope or objectives
The project will be undertaken as planned

components.label: Is your organization in immediate risk of closing, reducing operations, or laying-off staff? (i.e. within the next 6 months)
If yes, indicate the approximate number of staff who will be impacted via permanent or temporary lay-offs:
How many direct permanent jobs will be created at the project location as a result of the capital project?

components.html: How many direct permanent jobs will be created at the project location as a result of the capital project?
components.label: Text/Images
Full-time
components.content: Management-Level or Senior Roles (For example, over $70,000 per year)

components.label: HTML
components.content: Entry-Level Jobs (For example, less than $45,000 per year)

components.label: How many employees does your organization currently employ in BC?

Describe how your organization will ensure it can access the workforce needed to achieve and sustain your organization’s growth plans. Consider: Are there any current or anticipated workforce gaps or challenges that might impact implementation of this project? Are there any skills or jobs which will be a challenge to recruit for?
Will the project result in increased job opportunities for the following groups? (Check all that apply):
Aside from jobs, describe any other benefits the project and/or your organization bring to the local community.
Will your project create opportunities for Indigenous Peoples or First Nations? (Select all that apply)

values.label: My organization is Indigenous or First Nation-led (with 51% or more controlling interest).
My project will create an ongoing business opportunity for an Indigenous-led entity or First Nation-led enterprise (including as investor or partner with 50% or less controlling-interest).
My project creates a time-limited business opportunity for at least one Indigenous business (i.e. a contracting business used for the capital project).
My project brings benefits to an Indigenous community including through existing revenue sharing agreements and purchasing fibre from tenures.

components.label: With respect to clean, sustainable and innovative manufacturing processes, please select any of the following that apply to your operations and/or this project:

values.label: Adopts or is innovating to create low or zero-carbon intensity products, processes, or methods of production as a part of the project
Uses or creates biomaterials to decarbonize products such as concrete, asphalt and plastic components (beyond conventional lumber, pulp, paper, veneers and furniture)
Uses or is innovating to use low carbon fuels such as biodiesel or hydrogen
Uses zero-emission or low carbon fuel vehicles to transport goods
Creates bioenergy as a secondary benefit of the project (for own use or sale)
Creates or contributes to a circular economy by reusing, repairing, refurbishing, remanufacturing, repurposing, or recycling products and materials
Reduces other negative environmental impacts including responsible end-of-life product management and/or uses sustainable packaging options

components.label: Provide detail for all that you selected above and specify if any are related to the capital project:
Previous
Next

components.html:
Thank you for completing the detailed application form for Stream 2 – Capital Investment of the BC Manufacturing Jobs Fund. Program staff will follow up to request any additional information required to complete the funding assessment. 

Attestation

By submitting this form, I confirm that I have the authority to submit this request and agree to the conditions described below.

  1. All information contained herein is correct and complete to the best of my knowledge;
  2. Awarding of funding to successful applicants will be conditional upon finalization of a contribution agreement that sets out the terms and conditions of the funding (“Funds”);
  3. I consent to receiving email communications regarding this application from the Province of B.C. in relation to the BC Manufacturing Jobs Fund;
  4. I agree to retain supporting documentation and information including but not limited to invoices and receipts, for all expenditures made using the Funds (collectively, the “Supporting Documentation”) for a period of seven years from the date of receipt of the Funds;
  5. I agree that I will provide the Province with additional Supporting Documentation relating to my application or to the use of the Funds received, and agree that the Province may, at any reasonable time and on reasonable notice, attend at my place of business or other premises to inspect, and, at the Province’s discretion, review, copy and audit any records and other materials comprising or relating to the Supporting Documentation, whether produced by or provided to my business, where such records and other materials are the result of or related to the use of Funds and that I will provide reasonable assistance to the Province in exercising these rights; and
  6. I agree that repayment of Funds may be required if the Funds, or any part of them, are used for purposes other than those identified in the program materials as eligible expenses, or if my business is found to be ineligible or if any information provided in this application is not true and accurate.
components.label: Text/Images
I confirm that I have the authority to submit this request and agree to the conditions described above.
Previous
